snippet.title: TankCarnage teaser
snippet.description:
Woot! Alrighty! The game is finished, this is a teaser / trailer for the game, hope you like it. Now, when I say the game is finished, I mean single player mode is fully finished at the moment of altering my previous comment here.

You can download demo here: I closed the website, so the game is no longer available, sorry!

Minimal system requirements are: XP SP2, 3D card that supports Shader 2.0 (all 3D video cards manufactured since 2004). All the gamers already have better specs than this.

It's actually a full game, just in demo mode, one level enabled. Installer uses high compression, so the size of installer is 3 times smaller than the amount it will take on your hard disk.

If players' responses are good, I'll start developing multiplayer parts and I don't want to do that if players are not interested in the game because it will take at least 5-8 months of extra work to make it happen, since multiplayer parts will have lobby, network stuff, chat, achievements, online ranking system and whatnots. In any case, it's a lot of work I'd rather spend making another game or doing something else.

Woot! Alrighty! The game is finished, this is a teaser / trailer for the game, hope you like it. Now, when I say the game is finished, I mean single player mode is fully finished at the moment of altering my previous comment here.

You can download demo here: I closed the website, so the game is no longer available, sorry!

Minimal system requirements are: XP SP2, 3D card that supports Shader 2.0 (all 3D video cards manufactured since 2004). All the gamers already have better specs than this.

It's actually a full game, just in demo mode, one level enabled. Installer uses high compression, so the size of installer is 3 times smaller than the amount it will take on your hard disk.

If players' responses are good, I'll start developing multiplayer parts and I don't want to do that if players are not interested in the game because it will take at least 5-8 months of extra work to make it happen, since multiplayer parts will have lobby, network stuff, chat, achievements, online ranking system and whatnots. In any case, it's a lot of work I'd rather spend making another game or doing something else.
